result.execSummary:
The defendant William E Draughon III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William E Draughon III is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William E Draughon III was found guilty of Fail/Attach Ear Tag to Deer Carcass, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.347(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $1,000.00 PLUS ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 09-01-2016 or as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment;

Court revokes Chapter 29 privileges for 3 years;
Court orders the deer and crossbow confiscated pursuant to Chapter 29.931(2)(a).

charges.descr: Fail/Attach Ear Tag to Deer Carcass

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Craig S. Powell in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Parties have resolved issues.
On motion of the State by request of DNR correction made on the record as to the forfeiture of crossbow be amended to forfeiture of a Mathews Bow.  Defense to submit proposed order.

Defendant William E Draughon in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case set for status conference. State requesting more time to obtain more information from the department of natural resources.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 31.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan, Branch 31, for review. mag
Motion for an Order to Show cause

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING,  commencing MARCH 1, 2016, received and filed. (22 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to KOHLER HART POWELL, 735 N. WATER ST, STE 1212, MILWAUKEE, WI  53202
State's Request for Hearing under Wis. Stat. Section 29.931(2)(a) dated 4/20/16, received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant William E Draughon in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $1000.00 PLUS ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 09-01-2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Court revokes Chapter 29 privileges for 3 years.  Court orders the deer and crossbow confiscated pursuant to Chapter 29.931(2)(a).
Appeal rights given.

Defendant William E Draughon in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requested a motion hearing and jury trial date in Branch 21.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William E Draughon in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William E Draughon in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt for attorney Craig Powell.  
Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pretrial.  Defense motion to adjourn jury trial heard and granted by the Court.  No objection from the state.  Jury trial date of 1-27-16 removed from the calendar at this time.  Defense and the state not available on jury trial weeks available before Branch 21.  Status date selected for the purpose of rescheduling jury trial.  Status conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William E Draughon in court with attorney Geoffrey Misfeldt for Craig S. Powell.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William E Draughon in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Paul Thomas Eberhardy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William E Draughon in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation.  The defendant needs additional time to retain counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered NO HUNTING.  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  9/1/15. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant William E Draughon in court.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#15-168
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 8/31/15 @ 1:30 pm
